intro: Alyssum stylare, commonly known as the slender alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters and features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Alyssum stylare is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
